result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: for Payment of Fees for Deborah A. Strigenz $365.90

Defendant Shamar Junior Everette in court.  Attorney Deborah Ann Strigenz in court for Shamar Junior Everette.  Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss and read-in to 22CM682; Court so orders.  Hearing on 10-27-22 removed from the calendar.
(Copies mailed to Def and Def Atty)

Defendant Shamar Junior Everette in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was previously appointed Attorney Gordan Leech and requests new attorney be appointed to represent him.  Court appoints Atty Deborah Strigenz.  Defendant shall reimburse Washington County pursuant to the same payment plan already established.
Hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appears via video in custody from the Washington County Jail without counsel.  Defendant consents to appear by video.  Defendant has not had any contact with Atty. Pierce.   Atty. Pierce indicated earlier of a conflict with taking this case.  Defendant is serving a sanction.  Court will appoint successor counsel.  Atty. Gordon Leech is present in court and accepts the appointment.  Court appoints Atty. Gordon Leech.  Defendant shall reimburse Washington County at same rate, $50 per month commencing 9-01-2022.
Hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Prosecuting Attorney Stephanie L. Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears via video in custody from the Washington County Jail and by Atty. Timothy Drewa.  Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding right to be physically present at today's hearing and accepts consent to use of video conferencing.  Defendant given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Not guilty plea entered by Court.  Court appoints Atty. Barbara Pierce.  Defendant shall reimburse Washington County at a rate of $50 per month commencing 9-01-2022.  $750 signature bond set.  Hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Hearing on August 17, 2022 at 09:45 am.
